I think I can help you out!

If you're looking for a Christmas movie that's more on the lighter side, I'd recommend "Jingle All the Way". It's a fun and family-friendly film about a dad's mission to get his son the hottest toy of the season, Turbo Man. With Phil Hartman and Sinbad (and Chris Parnell) starring in it, you can expect some great comedic moments!

If you're open to something a bit more... unconventional, I'd suggest "Alex in Wonderland". It's a unique blend of comedy and drama that explores the creative process through Alex's own movie-making endeavors. With Jeanne Moreau and Ellen Burstyn as part of the cast, it's definitely worth considering!

I think I have just the right documentary-style war movie for you! Have you considered "Red Cliff" (2008)? It's a epic historical drama that takes place in ancient China, with stunning battle scenes and impressive performances from Wei Zhao and Takeshi Kaneshiro.

If you'd like something more recent, I'd recommend "American Sniper" (2014), starring Bradley Cooper as Chris Kyle, a brave and complex American sniper. The film explores the psychological toll of war on our veterans, making it a thought-provoking and emotional ride.
